entry.title: OREGONIANS SAY NO TO 3 OF 5 STATEWIDE BALLOT MEASURES
entry.summary: November 6, 2025 3:55 a.m. Oregon voters said no to 3 of 5 statewide ballot measures on Tuesday. entry.title: DEMOCRATS RETAIN HOLD ON STATEWIDE OFFICES IN OREGON
entry.summary: November 6, 2024 3:45 a.m. Democrats retained their hold on statewide offices in Oregon, according to results from the Oregon Secretary of State’s Office as of 3:00 a.m. Wednesday: Tobias Read was elected Oregon Secretary of State, beating Dennis Linthicum 54 percent to 43 percent. Linthicum won in Douglas County, getting 67 percent of the...

entry.title: HOYLE, BENTZ RETAIN THEIR CONGRESSIONAL SEATS

entry.title: INDUSTRIAL SLASH BURNING MAY INCREASE IN DOUGLAS DISTRICT
entry.summary: November 6, 2024 3:05 a.m. A persistent weather pattern of cooler temperatures and consistent rain has prompted a decrease in restrictions for industrial slash-burning on lands protected by the Douglas Forest Protective Association, effective on Monday. As a result, industrial slash burning may increase through the Douglas District. A DFPA release said these restrictions are...

entry.title: Voters overwhelmingly approve Tenmile tax levy
entry.summary: TENMILE — A tax levy assessed to Tenmile homeowners paying the salary of the local fire chief and other costs will extend another five years, following Tuesday’s election.

entry.title: Sutherlin residents continue psilocybin ban
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Psilocybin will continue to be banned in Sutherlin following a vote in Tuesday’s election.

entry.title: 5TH ANNUAL DCSO CHRISTMAS CARD DRAWING CONTEST IS UNDERWAY

entry.title: 5th Annual DCSO Christmas Card Drawing Contest Is Now Open! (Photo)
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY, Ore. - The Douglas County Sheriff's Office is hosting its 5th Annual Christmas Card Drawing Contest for Douglas County children. The specifics for the contest are listed below: ABOUT THE CONTEST: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office Christmas Card Contest is a drawing competition for children in Douglas County. One winner from each of the eligibility groups will be selected as the artist for the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office Official 2024 Christmas Card. ENTRY GUIDELINES: Entry Period: November 3, 2024 – December 2, 2024Eligibility: Group 1: Grades Pre-K – 2nd Group 2: Grades 3rd – 5th Group 3: Grades 6th – 8th Theme: A Sheriff’s Office Community Christmas HOW TO ENTER: Participants may create an original hand drawn entry on a contest drawing page or an 8.5 x…

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Christian volleyball sweeps Ione/Arlington, advances to 1A state tournament
